Content: Oil prices surged to $95 per barrel today amidst geopolitical tensions in the Middle East. Analysts fear this could drive up inflation rates across Europe and the US next quarter.
Consumer spending remains resilient despite rising fuel costs. However
column4: airlines are beginning to slash flight schedules due to the increased cost of jet fuel.

Content: Unexpected drop in crude oil reserves reported by the EIA. Markets reacted negatively
column4: with the S&P 500 dropping 1.2% by midday trading. Logistics companies are adding surcharges to deliveries.

Content: Renewable energy stocks are seeing a slight uptick as investors look for alternatives to volatile fossil fuel markets. Solar and wind ETFs are up 3% this week.
Electric vehicle sales have hit a record high for Q3
column4: likely driven by the sustained high gas prices at the pump. Traditional auto manufacturers are accelerating their EV transition plans.
